bug.author: domoritz
bug.summary: Simple altair chart throws error: "partially initialized module 'altair' has no attribute 'Chart' "
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I am trying to run a minimal altair example but I get an error about a partially imported module. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
streamlit run altair.py import altair as alt import numpy as np import pandas as pd import streamlit as st
df = pd.DataFrame( np.random.randn(200, 3), columns=['a', 'b', 'c'])
c = alt.Chart(df).mark_circle().encode( x='a', y='b', size='c', color='c')
st.altair_chart(c, width=-1) <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
I expect to see a chart. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/589034/73296014-aa4cb680-41bd-11ea-931c-0c9c4918ad9f.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
yes <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: v0.53.0 Python version: 3.8.0 Pyenv OS version: MacOS Browser version: Chrome

comments.comment: ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇ I shouldn't call my file altair.py. Works after renaming.
